intro: Tradescantia splendens, commonly known as the wandering jew, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its striking, lance-shaped leaves that range from bright green to purple. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of red, pink, or white, which bloom in clusters. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-draining soil and full to partial sunlight. Tradescantia splendens is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
